name: Daniel
address: 60 E 65th St, New York, NY 10065, USA

reviews.text: Daniel... very iconic food all tasted great, we didn't do the tasting menu. Did a few a La Carte dishes. The service was phenomenal. Pricy but experience was worth it.

Pleasantly surprised how nice this restaurant was - excellent value for the quality of food and service . Youâ€™ll get invited at the end of the meal to the kitchen to see where all the magic happens. Staff are hard working and take providing an excellent culinary experience seriously. Will be coming again when Iâ€™m next in New York!

We reserved Daniel for our Anniversary- it was a spectacular experience from beginning to end. I have dietary restrictions, and the chef was more than accommodating of them. Our Captain was Zach, followed by Serenity. I couldnâ€™t give them a better review. Everyone we encountered was amazing. We highly recommend!

was fully reserved for the dining room but we still wanna try it out, so we were at the lounge. vibes were okay, moderate noise, service was great, food was kind of too ordinary, canâ€™t remember any dish, beautifully presented but the flavor needs some improvements. in terms of the food, cafÃ© boulud and maison barnes do better imo. overall still good to try out.

Simply delightful in every way. Every dish shows thoughtful composition. I question whether some reviewers are being objective. The entire team exhibits friendly attitudes. Visit this spot and discover.
The best experience! Please visit if you have a special occasion to celebrate! They are very friendly and they take care of you on your special day!

While visiting NYC recently, wanted to experience fine dinning that was quintessentially New York. In my research, Daniel came highly recommended

I have had some really amazing fine dinning experiences in my local area of Australia and New Zealand but Daniel is at another stratospheric level of fine dinning. I am so glad that I actually had the opportunity to visit

My first night's experience of the delightful Mushroom ConsommÃ© followed by the Wagyu Beef and finished off with the Fig + Cheese Cake dessert was so incredible, I had to come back a second night to try their other delectable offerings

When I asked at the end of the first night if they were able to seat me the following night, the team was amazing and found me a spot

The second night was just as phenomenal with the Scallop Carpaccio, Blue Fin Tuna and Moroccan Chocolate

The service both nights was warm, welcoming and so personable which I so appreciate. The atmosphere was beautifully elegant. The food was at its own divine level of taste, textures and creativity

A big thank you to Daniel, Brian, Peter, Alan, Jorje, Matthew and the greater Daniel team for making me feel so welcome and the whole experience at Daniel - both nights so amazing. I do look forward to being back at Daniel soon

I was shooting some dice in the park with some vagrants, trying to make a few quick bucks when I started to feel a bit peckish. I was close by and thought I would pop in hoping to get seated last minute. Understandably I was turned away, I was wearing a Huey Lewis and the news tee-shirt that was covered in cigarette burns and ripped cargo pants as well as it being fully booked and not having a reservation. Cut to 3 weeks later my firm just got the A.P. Moller Maersk contract and I took my new Danish business associates here to celebrate. It was a lovely evening my company was impressed with the atmosphere and after a decadent evening I can confidently say this will be my new go to for entertaining
Incredible meal and service

We went for our wedding anniversary celebratory dinner without knowing very much about the restaurant . We were delighted with everything, the setting, the excellent service and the extraordinary food. My husband's comment "it's better than the taillevant " his favorite restaurant in Paris
Lovely dinner! I want to return again and again every night
ìŒì‹ì€ ì†”ì§íˆ í•œêµ­ì—ì„œë„ ë¨¹ì„ìˆ˜ìˆì„ì •ë„ ì…ë‹ˆë‹¤ í•˜ì§€ë§Œ ì„œë¹„ìŠ¤ë‚˜ ë¶„ìœ„ê¸°ê°€ ì •ë§ ì¢‹ê¸°ì— í•œë²ˆì¯¤ ê°€ë³¼ë§Œ í•©ë‹ˆë‹¤ ê·¸ë¦¬ê³  ë””ì €íŠ¸ê°€ ì •ë§ ë§›ìˆìŠµë‹ˆë‹¤

I finally had the chance to dine at Daniel for my birthday and we opted for the 5-course prix fixe menu.

Canapes: Excellent start. There was a uni bite I really enjoyed, though I wish I remembered the restâ€”it all went by quickly but set the tone nicely.

Maine Sea Scallop Carpaccio: A solid beginning to the courses. The scallop paired beautifully with grapefruitâ€”fresh, light, and delicious.

Warm Seafood Fricassee: This one was interesting. It came with small pieces of snail, octopus, squid, mussels, a SINGLE small pieces of lobster, and scallop. The seafood itself was great, though the sauce threw me offâ€”it had a peanut or nutty flavor that didnâ€™t work for me (personal preference, since Iâ€™m not a fan of nutty sauces). The squid was also a little chewy. Funny enough, while I was jotting notes on my phone, the waiter came over almost immediately to check in and even offered to replace the dish. I appreciated the attentiveness but decided to keep it.

Black Cod: Served with caviar and beluga lentils. The texture of the fish was tender and cooked well, though slightly bland.

Pennsylvania Duck: Perfectly cookedâ€”medium and tenderâ€”but I wasnâ€™t a fan of the olives embedded in the duck or the pecan sauce, which I felt didnâ€™t complement the dish.

Mekonga (Dessert): A dark chocolate dessert with coconut milk jam. I didnâ€™t get much of the coconut flavor, but overall it was a solid, well balanced dessert.

They also served freshly baked madeleines at the end, which were decent but not particularly memorable. The chocolate piece with gold flakes looked pretty but didnâ€™t taste special, and the mini coffee macaron was a definite miss for me.

At the end of the night, they invited us into the kitchen for a quick look. It was a kind gesture, though there wasnâ€™t much to seeâ€”nice touch, but not particularly rewardingâ€¦ mehâ€¦

Overall, Iâ€™d give Daniel a strong 4 stars. The service was exceptionalâ€”though it did slow down once the restaurant got busy, and we ended up waiting almost 30 minutes for dessert. Still, it was a great experience overall. A few dishes could use small tweaks. But, solid
The food was delicious.  The staff were friendly and helpful.  They even let us tour the kitchen.  They accommodated our vegetarian and our shell fish allergy, with great food.

The taste of food is not its highlight, but I really had a great experiencing dining here! The presentation of dishes is among the best Iâ€™ve seen, beating other Michelin three star restaurants. Service and vibe are also the top tier. Every staff from front desk to table service are friendly and welcoming.

I took a friend to Daniel for a birthday dinner, a restaurant I had long been eager to try, but I left very disappointed. I opted for the three-course prix fixe: the scallop carpaccio was bland, and the duck was overly salty, tough, and greasy. The desserts, however, were excellent. Based on my experience, I suspect its Michelin star rests largely on presentation and pastry, rather than the overall quality of the meal.
A culinary delight that is seldom experienced anywhere else !

As close to perfect as possible.
Best service in Manhattan.
What can you say.  Itâ€™s Daniel.  They will exceed all expectations!  I feel so blessed to have dined here twice in my lifetime. â¤ï¸

For individuals such as myself and wife, who do not eat in the millionaire class of restaurant, our anniversary dinner at Daniel was a revelatory experience that we will cherish for the rest of our lives. Every plate demonstrated mastery of multitudes of culinary technique and deep caring and thought. The entire staff treated us as welcome guests. The atmosphere was beautiful, highly professional, but also comfortable and relaxed. And if I may say so, although the evening is expensive objectively, it is not expensive for the food and experience received. Compare Daniel with the many mediocre $100+ â€œomakeseâ€ sushi restaurants, and Daniel is a bargain.
Loved the foodÃ¢â‚¬â€stellar spot!
Super also auch in Billions

Exquisite.  From the team of people that hosted us, to the visual experience of the food and the newly installed art, to every scrumptious bite. This is the standard to which all dining experiences will be compared against and never match.
Their seasonal offerings give me a reason to come back. The whole team treats guests with respect. This place makes food with care. The restaurant validates positive opinions. GENUINELY SUPERB.

Dining at Daniel was an extraordinary experience from start to finish. I have several dietary restrictions, and Matthew, the maitre dâ€™hÃ´tel, went above and beyond to make sure I felt completely safe and cared for. He worked seamlessly with the culinary team to design a custom five-course tasting menu that eliminated every concern without hesitation.

The communication beforehand was outstanding â€” not only did they clearly confirm everything via email, but Matthew even called to assure me that preparations were made in the back to avoid any cross-contamination. That kind of detail and thoughtfulness is rare, and it set the tone for a worry-free evening.

The food itself was unbelievable â€” beautifully prepared, balanced, and truly memorable. Between the flawless service, Matthewâ€™s exceptional care, and the incredible dishes, this was an out-of-this-world dining experience. Daniel is a restaurant that takes hospitality and cuisine to the highest level.

Absolute perfection from the moment we walked. Had a wonderful cocktail at the beautiful bar before heading into dinner, the Bartenders, Chip and Wilson, were a delight. The dining room is subdued elegance and sets the perfect mood for an exceptional evening. Food: delicious, inventive, and beautifully plated. Service: telepathic, never hovering but always there, friendly, knowledgeable, and engaging. Captain and Servers: exceptional. Sommelier: spot on recommendations based upon conversation.

Ended the evening with a tour of the kitchen, a truly precise operation.

Already planning a return visit.

Draft Review

â­ï¸â­ï¸â­ï¸â­ï¸â­ï¸

I had the French bouillabaisse at Daniel and it was out of this world â€” rich, complex, and absolutely unforgettable. But what made the evening truly once-in-a-lifetime was having dinner at The Skybox, right inside the kitchen. Watching the brigade at work, every plate crafted like a symphony of art, was mesmerizing. You see the precision, the passion, the dedication to excellence in every movement.

And then â€” meeting Chef Daniel himself. What a moment. He is not only a master of cuisine but also a gentleman of rare warmth and generosity. He made us feel unique, welcomed, and valued, taking time to speak with us with genuine sincerity. It wasnâ€™t just a meal, it was an experience that touched the heart as much as the palate. Truly one of the most memorable evenings of my life.

An evening at Daniel is more than just dinner â€“ itâ€™s a true experience. We visited as a party of two and chose the five-course menu. Each dish was a masterpiece: refined in flavor, perfectly balanced, and beautifully presented.

The service was attentive, professional, and genuinely warm â€“ striking just the right balance that makes a night feel special. The ambiance also deserves praise: elegant, serene, and inviting, creating the perfect setting to savor each moment.

Daniel is where culinary excellence meets top-tier hospitality. Whether you're celebrating a special occasion or simply treating yourself, itâ€™s an absolute must.
Lâ€™un des meilleurs restaurantsâ€¦ Pour moi, le meilleur Ã  New York. Tout Ã©tait parfait. Les plats sont aussi beaux que bon.  Ã‰lÃ©gance raffinement, tout y Ã©tait. Merci ğŸ¤©
French fine dining with impeccable service.

This place stands out from other restaurants. Staff members were incredibly attentive. The kitchen delivers good quality consistently. Their servings will fill you up and every dish was tasty. I'm eager to experience this restaurant again.

A delightful experience. Delicious food, artistic preparation, and outstanding service. Beautifully strikes a balance between elevated dining and an inviting atmosphere manifested through the warmth of the staff.
For me this is a super special occasion restaurant. The service is impeccable and very friendly. The food was very good.

The food was truly exceptional! They wowed us with a tour of the kitchen afterwards! They have earned their Michelin star! One of the best meals of our lives. Mynor our waiter was outstanding.  Also Serenity and Daniel were standouts
Menu was awful, we are canâ€™t enjoy at all. Service was weird, waiter show very old Rolex  all time in my face in any moment, looks crazy. Definitely need change the menu
Daniel is amazing. What a place it doesn't disappoint.

We had the most magical dinner for our wedding night! The service is astounding- Jorge our server for the evening was knowledgeable, humorous, and had an easy yet professional demeanor. His attention to detail was outstanding. Obviously, the food was beautiful AND beyond delicious.
A true 10/10 restaurant across the board: service, food, atmosphere
best service and food!!

Daniel is unequivocally one of my favorite fine dining restaurants in New York City, and every visit to Daniel is an indulgent journey into high-level gastronomy.

I always choose the eight course tasting menu, and my two standout favorites over the years are their New York foie gras and Maine sea scallops, each bite exquisitely crafted. Every course arrives as a work of art, beautifully plated, deeply flavorful, and thoughtfully paced. It is the literal definition of culinary artistry and fine dining.

The experience is elegant from start to finish. The service is polished yet warm, and the dining room is refined with coffered ceilings, sparkling chandeliers, and understated sophistication. Though the pricing is high, with the eight course menu running around $295 to $300 per person, for NYC standards this is absolutely worth it, especially if you are celebrating a special occasion or just want to splurge on truly memorable food.

What saddens me is that Michelin currently rates Daniel at only one star, a puzzling demotion for a restaurant that consistently delivers excellence in execution and creativity. Daniel previously held two Michelin stars, and before that even three, which makes this latest rating feel like an injustice.

Despite Michelinâ€™s concerns about inconsistency, to me Daniel remains a gem, a place where passion for seasonal French cuisine meets meticulous presentation, and where each course showcases top tier ingredients like foie gras and scallops at their peak. Every visit reaffirms why it remains one of the finest and most reliable dining experiences in New York.

In short, it is expensive, but absolutely worth it. If you are looking to celebrate or treat yourself, Daniel never disappoints.
Loved the foodÃ¢â‚¬â€stellar spot!

We had the best meal at Daniel!  The food was unforgettable, but what really made this the best experience was the staff. They were friendly, professional, and went out of their way to make it a fabulous night!

Daniel is a wonderful restaurant. The food, atmosphere and service are spectacular. Pascal and Luna were both amazing during our visit. highly recommend the lounge over the formal dining area in my experience. It provides a lovely ambiance in an intimate setting.

If you are going to drive into the city and want a glimpse of old money New York - this is the place. Please dress accordingly.  When I was younger I used to walk past this place in hopes of one day dining (affording) such a luxurious meal. Well, a few months ago that dream came true, now living in the burbs we made our way in for a day to explore the MET (wore Fly Londons elegant but very comfortable) and then had the most glamourous dinner. No photos because we didn't want to behave like tourists.  Not that they would mind but we wanted to travel back in time and enjoy the service, food, wine and ambience like our parents would have. P.S. Set aside a few bucks $$$  It's worth it.
We often eat here when we come into the city and it never disappoints.  The food, service and atmosphere are all excellent.  A superior experience.

Take time to celebrate with some fine dining.
Excellent food and service.   Atmosphere a little closeâ€¦ overall a very enjoyable dinner.

Amazing restaurant- the staff was very attentive and kind. The wine service was spectacular.
The food courses were good, maybe my expectations were too high but I was not blown away by any of them. Still a beautiful restaurant and experience.

that kitchen tour was unforgetable!! playing like ratatoiulle game..... thank you. please have some spicy food like shin noodle as menu options.... as final... so one can wake up after fantastic french dishes....one bottle of premium wine order, you need to expect $1000 tips.

Came here for a private event and it was truly a 5 star service from waiting to the room and the server making sure i had a cold glass of water. To the amazing meal and dessert. Staff was all really friendly and knew what they were doing while also having a great attention to detail and dietary restrictions. While the food was great i truly enjoyed the bread the garlic ciabatta was so good i wanted seconds.
Amazing

I really enjoyed my time at Daniel last night. The restaurant has a lot of history and it's a really beautiful restaurant. The bar is amazing too. My server gave perfect service and I wish him the best. The presentation of the dishes were extremely creative like a work of art. Many 3 star restaurants don't have such creativity and presentation to their dishes. I really enjoyed the rabbit dish and the lamb saddle. The sauces paired with both of these dishes were amazing. I also enjoyed their array of breads to choose from as well as the cheese tray add on. That was excellent. Overall, I recommend coming to Daniel for an excellent meal, service, and a memorable experience. I've been to around 50 Michelin star restaurants so I can compare this restaurant to others. I think this restaurant is definitely worth a visit as it sets its self apart from other Michelin star restaurants.

The experience at Daniel begins even before you sit at the table. Days before my visit, I received a thoughtful email from Penn, who personally welcomed me with great warmth on the day of the reservation â€” a gesture of hospitality that already reflects the restaurantâ€™s standard of excellence.

While waiting for my companion, I went to the bar and accepted a recommendation from one of the staff to try a signature cocktail. A perfect choice: balanced, sophisticated, and full of personality â€” the drink set the tone for the culinary journey that would follow.

In the main dining room, we were welcomed by Allan, whose impeccable service elevated the entire evening. With technical mastery and evident passion, he introduced each dish with rich detail, providing context about the ingredients, techniques, and origins. Each course was a true sensory exploration â€” complex flavors, refined presentation, and surprising textures.

At the end of the dinner, we had the opportunity to visit the kitchen. The space conveyed discipline and organization, reflecting the same care present in every dish served.

Without a doubt, Daniel delivers a high-level gastronomic experience, defined by attention to detail and the dedication of the entire team. A truly special evening in one of New Yorkâ€™s Michelin-starred classics.

We chose the 5-course tasting menu.

Dining at Daniel was an unforgettable experience from start to finish. I did the 5-course tasting menu, and every dish was beautifully crafted and absolutely deliciousâ€”elevated without being overly fussy.

The service was beyond awesomeâ€”so warm, attentive, and polished. As a special touch, I even got to tour the kitchen and see where the chefs work their magic, including a peek at Chef Daniel Bouludâ€™s office! That behind-the-scenes moment made the night feel even more special.

If youâ€™re looking for fine dining that delivers on both flavor and experience, Daniel is a must.

@raquelgerlani

Restaurant Daniel is an exquisite slice of heaven on earth.  True artistry!  We have dined here many times now over the years and it is without a doubt one of the finest restaurants we have ever had the pleasure to experience.  Start to finish, it is sheer joy to behold.  The service is impeccable, and the ambiance is stunning, yet relaxing all at once.  We were there to celebrate a birthday and the staff couldn't have made it more special.  We were even invited to tour the kitchen at the end of our meal, something I will never forget.  There aren't enough accolades to describe how truly special dining at Daniel is.

Celebrated our 22nd wedding anniversary at one of our favourite restaurants in the world. Food and service were excellent, just as we remembered but the ambiance we found to be not as cosy and warm as before (found the lighting to be too bright). A wonderful dinner nonetheless and we will definitely be back!

My husband and I went to celebrate our first wedding anniversary. What a special treat. We opted for the 9 course and wine pairing. The food was excellent. The staff was super friendly. The explanations were clear and our asking questions was received with grace and excitement to share more knowledge. We were even taken to the kitchen to capture a picture and presented with a menu booklet commemorating the date. When another milestone moment comes, I wouldn't hesitate to return. I didn't take many pictures because I wanted to just be present, and it was so with just experiencing the scene. Thank you for making this such a special evening!

We celebrated our anniversary at Daniel, and it was truly an unforgettable experience. The nine-course tasting menu was an adventure in fine dining, with each dish showcasing meticulous attention to detail and an incredible depth of flavor. From the first bite to the last, the food was nothing short of extraordinary.
The service was impeccableâ€”attentive yet unobtrusive, with the staff making us feel special throughout the evening. Every course was beautifully presented
That said, while we appreciated the abundance and variety of the tasting menu, it was quite a lot of food! By the end, we were overwhelmed, which slightly detracted from fully savoring the final courses.
Overall, Daniel exceeded our expectations in almost every way, delivering a luxurious and celebratory dining experience. Itâ€™s a place weâ€™ll fondly remember and highly recommend to anyone seeking an exceptional culinary journeyâ€”just come prepared for a feast!

An exceptional fine dining experience â€” refined, beautifully paced, and flawlessly executed. Every course felt thoughtful and precise, with standout service to match. Will come back again and again.

My wife and I had a Friday night reservation for our 10th anniversary and had an absolutely outstanding experience. We did the 5 course tasting menu with wine pairings and all portions and pourings were so delicious and generous. The entire staff made us feel welcomed and honored, the sommelier was so kind and informative, and everyone was so accommodating. Absolute cannot-miss dishes include the hamachi, potato gnocchi, duck breast, pork chop, lamb saddle, and blood orange dessert.

Amazing Dinner!!

We greatly enjoyed every course! Particularly the Lamb and Karpachi were amazing

Each course was well prepared and presented

All of the staff was amazing and personable.  We are generally very informal and the staffâ€™s personal interaction with us put us at ease and comfortable in a much more formal dinner environment.

Thank You for an Amazing Birthday Dinner
Allen & Cindy
Albuquerque, NM

Our experience at Daniel was top notch. The staff were friendly and engaging.  The atmosphere was gorgeous and the food exceeded our expectations.  We did the 9 course tasting menu with wine supplement.  The pairings were superb.  An excellent evening all around.

My friend booked Daniel for my birthday , and it was absolutely incredible! The food was amazing, the ambiance felt like a royal palace, and the service was impeccable. From the moment I walked in until the end, every staff member wished me Happy Birthdayâ€”the emotional value was off the charts! ğŸ’–

Great food, stunning atmosphere, and top-tier serviceâ€”truly an unforgettable experience! ğŸ¥‚

Our evening at Daniel NYC began on a high note with a warm welcome and a stunning ambianceâ€”certainly among the cityâ€™s best settings for fine dining. We opted for the seven-course tasting menu with wine pairings, hoping for an unforgettable culinary journey. However, as the evening progressed, the dishes fell surprisingly short on flavor, leaving much to be desired in taste and creativity. Additionally, the service, while polished, lacked genuine engagement. Some servers seemed to be going through the motions, delivering rehearsed lines rather than showing true attentiveness to the guests. While the setting is exceptional, the overall experience felt more style than substance.

Iâ€™ve been to Restaurant Daniel.. it never gets old and better than this!!
My recent experience with my family was totally luxurious and I was in awe when they brought us the impeccably stunning efficient service and the amazing presentation throughout the time of our dinner. Thank you Alexandra for being so kind and thoughtful. Mr Brian ( the manager) made time to emailed and called me and reached out to explain how I can be reassured by his team members. Started with the first welcoming smile from Ashley. I have met the politeness of your staff like Chris, Allen and Laura, to the entire team.
Chris was very helpful and humorous as well!! There was no dull moment. We had the opportunity to see the beautiful kitchen at the back where a lot of guests were enjoying to see.
The five pre fixe menu was very well presented and simultaneously served. I was impressed by how well systematic and synchronized they did â€¦ itâ€™s really impressive!!!! We had a big long table of 13 guests. Especially located in the corner where we canâ€™t get other guests distracted and disturbedâ€¦ well thought out and planned for.
Restaurant Daniel stood up to me wildest expectations and even more.
The only thing I could say is that, the restrooms located. It was quite steep and probably challenging to those guests who have physical disabilities and older in general. I would like a need to be concerned about safety although it has a sturdy railing.
I will share the photos and videos for you to see.
Definitely I will highly recommend this opulent place.
The entire team deserves high praises for their dedication and professionalism to commit such great work and service!!!
Kudos to Chef Daniel Boulud !!!!

I consider one of the best restaurants in the whole world. Firstly the interior designer is impressive with such a nice taste for art and the wood panels in organic lines. Itâ€™s sublime, you feel that you are in an Italian Palazzo, but a modern one. The staff is beyond friendly, they are well prepared. Sydney was very certain and confident about the wines and made the right choices for both of us. I love to find people passionate about what they do in life, this makes a huge difference. We chose the option in the menu with 5 courses, all them extremely well presented and deliciously each one. We only missed a piano as background, but the atmosphere was so welcoming and the other guests so respectfully quiet that we felt honoured to be in the middle. Highly recommend this restaurant for everyone that wants a nice dinner and gastronomic experience in French cuisine in Manhattan. My partner is French, and he approved everything and agreed with my feedback. We will definitely will return next time in NY.

Celebrated a special day at Daniel and was very happy with the decision. Professional and attentive staff that are very accommodating and knowledgeable.

We went with the five course tasting menu, which started with a delightful set of amuse bouche. Bread service had this unforgettable brioche that had a flaky crust similar to a croissant.  All breads were served warm with very good quality butter.

It's hard to get into detail with the food because of the delicate and complex composition that each dish presents. Everything served was delicious and innovative. I'm not sure how often the menu changes, but i encourage you to take a look. Good food at a restaurant of this caliber is expected,  but when I leave the establishment having learned new food terms,  eye-opening techniques, and feel the sense of care put into everything they do, elevates the experience that much more,

I have posted a few photos of the dishes, but please forgive phone cam color balance. They don't do the actual justice.  The restaurant is well lit in a way that is not harsh but also not dim like some are. All the lighting, art, and textures are placed in a way that isn't in your face but compliments the restaurant as a whole.

It certainly is a bucket list restaurant for us, and we surely will be back sooner than later.

It is a decent French restaurant in the US, which is not so common these days.
The price can be quite expensive when you decide to have a good time - spent a little more than 5000 USD for three people without opening a bottle of wine. Overall itâ€™s a great formal dinner for new year eve.

This had to have been one of the best dining experiences in my life. I have eaten at so many Michelin restaurants around the world and the service at this place was absolutely outstanding. A 200/10 rating in terms of service. our waiter (Matthew who is now a Maitre D there!) had been working there for many years, gave fantastic suggestions on what to order, helped us figure out if we want a whole bottle of wine what type of wine, and how much of it we should order in conjunction with our meal. What really pushed the service over the top was that everything was perfectly organized, and our waiter went to the back room to even ask if they had extra leftover pastries for us as they had some freshly baked ones earlier that day. We left this restaurant so ridiculously fooled because of all the free dessert. Everything was cooked to perfection and tasted amazing. The interior was beautiful. We got a great side table where we could people watch and enjoy, the wine was superb. 100% would go back again and definitely recommend. I even felt that the price was actually quite fair considering the ingredient quality and amount of food you get 10 out of 10 place. Update 2024: we returned and were served by Matthew and Jorge, service, food and ambiance still exceptional. Will definitely return as usual!

Still one of the greatest New York restaurants.  The langoustine crudo is the best in the world.  The John Dory also was excellent.  Scallops can be difficult to make good and here Daniel failed, it seemed undercooked and tasteless. But the worst was the lamb which was extraordinarily tasteless and not at all enjoyable to eat.  It had the texture of lamb but no flavor at all, the sauce was quite bland.  The service was excellent and the small bites and dessert quite good.  But places like this as culinary experiences have fallen far behind places like Frevo.  Donâ€™t come for the food, but the experience is great.

This was undoubtedly the best dining experience of my life. We were celebrating our first anniversary. The food, the service, the surroundings all equaled perfection. Every staff member made us feel special. Our waiter answered every question with a level of professionalism that comes with years of trained knowledge. Chef Boulud even came over to check in with us after the meal. The five course tasting menu was phenomenal , it was so hard to make our choices. For anyone that has an event to celebrate this is your place!

This past Sunday I had the great pleasure of dining at Daniel with great friends in celebration of my birthday.
We had the four course tasting menu and we were stuffed.  They had several extra little nibbles come out in addition to the ordered courses which was really great.   The food was presented creatively and was delicious.   The flavors were well balanced and the menu offered a broad range of choices.

The drinks were presented beautifully and were equally delicious.

The service was outstanding and what I expected at a Michelin star restaurant.   It really makes a big difference to be taken care   of with such care.

This was the perfect restaurant to bring in a special birthday or other occasion.   Thank you to the team at Daniel for making it very special and Iâ€™ll be happy to come back.
We had a lovely time celebrating our anniversary at Daniel. The service, food, and ambiance are perfect. This place is definitely right on top of my list of places to dine!

This is not a review. This is just to say how much my wife and I enjoyed eating at Daniel! Pascal made our experience beyond enjoyable and the food was mind-blowing. The flavors were complex. They came from an unexpected combination of familiar foods with surprising flavors. I'm not pretentious enough to criticize the food. By the end of dinner, Pascal was like family. It was an amazing experience and Chef Daniel is a genius.

From the second you walk in, the experience begins.  Everyone is so nice and helpful.  I think I got 10 good evenings on the way to my table.  The restaurant is beautiful and so elegant.  Service was impeccable!  I ordered the 9-course tasting menu and it was incredible.  The entire evening was truly amazing and the staff was perfection.  I was also given a tour of the kitchen which was so impressive to see everyone in action.  I made one last stop at the bar and had a wonderful drink.  Incredible evening in NYC!
